motifs.name: Zinc finger, C2H2 type
motifs.description: The C2H2 zinc finger is the classical zinc finger domain. The two conserved cysteines and histidines co-ordinate a zinc ion. The following pattern describes the zinc finger. #-X-C-X(1-5)-C-X3-#-X5-#-X

motifs.name: bZIP transcription factor
motifs.description: The Pfam entry includes the basic region and the leucine zipper region.

motifs.name: Myb-like DNA-binding domain
motifs.description: This family contains the DNA binding domains from Myb proteins, as well as the SANT domain family [[cite:PUB00005459]].

motifs.name: Response regulator receiver domain
motifs.description: This domain receives the signal from the sensor partner in bacterial two-component systems. It is usually found N-terminal to a DNA binding effector domain.

motifs.name: Bromodomain
motifs.description: Bromodomains are 110 amino acid long domains, that are found in many chromatin associated proteins. Bromodomains can interact specifically with acetylated lysine [[cite:PUB00004293]].

motifs.name: PHD-finger
motifs.description: PHD folds into an interleaved type of Zn-finger chelating 2 Zn ions in a similar manner to that of the RING and FYVE domains [[cite:PUB00018073]].  Several PHD fingers have been identified as binding

motifs.name: SET domain
motifs.description: SET domains are protein lysine methyltransferase enzymes. SET domains appear to be protein-protein interaction domains. It has been demonstrated that SET domains mediate interactions with a family of

motifs.name: C2H2-type zinc finger
motifs.description: This family contains a number of divergent C2H2 type zinc fingers.

motifs.name: Helix-turn-helix
motifs.description: This large family of DNA binding helix-turn helix proteins includes Cro [swissprot:P03036] and CI [swissprot:P03034]. Within the protein [swissprot:Q5F9C2], the full protein fold incorporates a helix-

motifs.name: Protein tyrosine and serine/threonine kinase
motifs.description: Protein phosphorylation, which plays a key role in most cellular activities, is a reversible process mediated by protein kinases and  phosphoprotein phosphatases. Protein kinases catalyse the transfer

motifs.name: Calcineurin-like phosphoesterase
motifs.description: This family includes a diverse range of phosphoesterases [[cite:PUB00019430]], including protein phosphoserine phosphatases, nucleotidases, sphingomyelin phosphodiesterases and 2'-3' cAMP phosphodiest

motifs.name: Matrixin
motifs.description: The members of this family are enzymes that cleave peptides. These proteases require zinc for catalysis.

motifs.name: Peptidase C13 family
motifs.description: Members of this family are asparaginyl peptidases [[cite:PUB00003009]]. The blood fluke parasite Schistosoma mansoni has at least five Clan CA cysteine peptidases in its digestive tract including cath

motifs.name: Eukaryotic aspartyl protease
motifs.description: Aspartyl (acid) proteases include pepsins, cathepsins, and renins.  Two-domain structure, probably arising from ancestral duplication.  This family does not include the retroviral nor retrotransposon

motifs.name: O-methyltransferase domain
motifs.description: This family includes a range of O-methyltransferases. These enzymes utilise S-adenosyl methionine.

motifs.name: Cytochrome P450
motifs.description: Cytochrome P450s are haem-thiolate proteins [[cite:PUB00019975]] involved in the oxidative degradation of various compounds. They are particularly well known for their role in the degradation of envir

motifs.name: ATPase family associated with various cellular activities (AAA)
motifs.description: AAA family proteins often perform chaperone-like functions that assist in the assembly, operation, or disassembly of protein complexes [[cite:PUB00005841]].

motifs.name: ABC transporter
motifs.description: ABC transporters for a large family of proteins responsible for translocation of a variety of compounds across biological membranes.  ABC transporters are the largest family of proteins in many comple

motifs.name: Beta-lactamase
motifs.description: This family appears to be distantly related to [pfam:PF00905] and PF00768 D-alanyl-D-alanine carboxypeptidase.

motifs.name: SH3 domain
motifs.description: SH3 (Src homology 3) domains are often indicative of a protein involved in signal transduction related to cytoskeletal organisation. First described in the Src cytoplasmic tyrosine kinase [swissprot:P

motifs.name: PDZ domain
motifs.description: PDZ domains are found in diverse signaling proteins.

motifs.name: SAM domain (Sterile alpha motif)
motifs.description: It has been suggested that SAM is an evolutionarily conserved protein binding domain that is involved in the regulation of numerous developmental processes in diverse eukaryotes. The SAM domain can po

motifs.name: PH domain
motifs.description: PH stands for pleckstrin homology.

motifs.name: Phospholipase D Active site motif
motifs.description: Phosphatidylcholine-hydrolysing phospholipase D (PLD) isoforms are activated by ADP-ribosylation factors (ARFs). PLD produces phosphatidic acid from phosphatidylcholine, which may be essential for the

motifs.name: Transforming growth factor beta like domain
7 transmembrane receptor (rhodopsin family)
motifs.description: This family contains, amongst other G-protein-coupled receptors (GCPRs), members of the opsin family, which have been considered to be typical members of the rhodopsin superfamily. They share several

motifs.name: Immunoglobulin domain
motifs.description: Members of the immunoglobulin superfamily are found in hundreds of proteins of different functions. Examples include antibodies, the giant muscle kinase titin and receptor tyrosine kinases. Immunoglob

motifs.name: Leucine Rich Repeat
motifs.description: CAUTION: This Pfam may not find all Leucine Rich Repeats in a protein.  Leucine Rich Repeats are short sequence motifs present in a number of proteins with diverse functions and cellular locations.  T

motifs.name: Ankyrin repeat
motifs.description: Ankyrins are multifunctional adaptors that link specific proteins to the membrane-associated, spectrin- actin cytoskeleton. This repeat-domain is a 'membrane-binding' domain of up to 24 repeated units

motifs.name: KH domain
motifs.description: KH motifs bind RNA in vitro. Autoantibodies to Nova, a KH domain protein, cause paraneoplastic opsoclonus ataxia.

motifs.name: Phorbol esters/diacylglycerol binding domain (C1 domain)
motifs.description: This domain is also known as the Protein kinase C conserved region 1 (C1) domain.

motifs.name: Ras family
motifs.description: Includes sub-families Ras, Rab, Rac, Ral, Ran, Rap Ypt1 and more. Shares P-loop motif with GTP_EFTU, arf and myosin_head. See [pfam:PF00009] [pfam:PF00025], [pfam:PF00063]. As regards Rab GTPases, the

motifs.name: ADP-ribosylation factor family
motifs.description: Pfam combines a number of different Prosite families together

motifs.name: GTPase-activator protein for Ras-like GTPase
motifs.description: All alpha-helical domain that accelerates the GTPase activity of Ras, thereby "switching" it into an "off" position.

motifs.name: RhoGEF domain
motifs.description: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor for Rho/Rac/Cdc42-like GTPases Also called Dbl-homologous (DH) domain. It appears that [pfam:PF00169] domains invariably occur C-terminal to RhoGEF/DH domains.

motifs.name: Ras association (RalGDS/AF-6) domain
motifs.description: RasGTP effectors (in cases of AF6, canoe and RalGDS); putative RasGTP effectors in other cases. Recent evidence (not yet in MEDLINE) shows that some RA domains do NOT bind RasGTP. Predicted structure

motifs.name: 7 transmembrane receptor (Secretin family)
motifs.description: This family is known as Family B, the secretin-receptor family or family 2 of the G-protein-coupled receptors (GCPRs). They have been described in many animal species, but not in plants, fungi or prok

motifs.name: 7 transmembrane sweet-taste receptor of 3 GCPR
motifs.description: This is a domain of seven transmembrane regions that forms the C-terminus of some subclass 3 G-coupled-protein receptors. It is often associated with a downstream cysteine-rich linker domain, NCD3G [p

motifs.name: EGF-like domain
motifs.description: There is no clear separation between noise and signal. [pfam:PF00053] is very similar, but has 8 instead of 6 conserved cysteines. Includes some cytokine receptors. The EGF domain misses the N-terminu

motifs.name: Ion transport protein
motifs.description: This family contains sodium, potassium and calcium ion channels. This family is 6 transmembrane helices in which the last two helices flank a loop which determines ion selectivity. In some sub-familie

motifs.name: EF hand domain
motifs.description: The EF-hands can be divided into two classes: signalling proteins and buffering/transport proteins.  The first group is the largest and includes the most well-known members of the family such as calmo

motifs.name: Hsp70 protein
motifs.description: Hsp70 chaperones help to fold many proteins. Hsp70 assisted folding involves repeated cycles of substrate binding and release.  Hsp70 activity is ATP dependent. Hsp70 proteins are made up of two regio

motifs.name: RNA recognition motif
motifs.description: The RRM motif (a.k.a. RRM, RBD, or RNP domain) is probably diagnostic of an RNA binding protein. RRMs are found in a variety of RNA binding proteins, including various hnRNP proteins, proteins implica

motifs.name: Zinc knuckle
motifs.description: The zinc knuckle is a zinc binding motif composed of the the following CX2CX4HX4C where X can be any amino acid. The motifs are mostly from retroviral gag  proteins (nucleocapsid). Prototype structure

motifs.name: Helicase conserved C-terminal domain
motifs.description: The Prosite family is restricted to DEAD/H helicases, whereas this domain family is found in a wide variety of helicases and helicase related proteins. It may be that this is not an autonomously foldi

motifs.name: LSM domain
motifs.description: The LSM domain contains Sm proteins as well as other related LSM (Like Sm) proteins. The U1, U2, U4/U6, and U5 small nuclear ribonucleoprotein particles (snRNPs) involved in pre-mRNA splicing contain

motifs.name: S1 RNA binding domain
motifs.description: The S1 domain occurs in a wide range of RNA associated proteins. It is structurally similar to cold shock protein which binds nucleic acids. The S1 domain has an OB-fold structure.

motifs.name: Cystatin domain
motifs.description: Very diverse family.  Attempts to define separate sub-families failed.  Typically, either the N-terminal or C-terminal end is very divergent.  But splitting into two domains would make very short fami

motifs.name: von Willebrand factor type A domain
short chain dehydrogenase
motifs.description: This family contains a wide variety of dehydrogenases.

motifs.name: Aldehyde dehydrogenase family
motifs.description: This family of dehydrogenases act on aldehyde substrates. Members use NADP as a cofactor. The family includes the following members: The prototypical members are the aldehyde dehydrogenases [swissprot

motifs.name: Beta-ketoacyl synthase, N-terminal domain
motifs.description: The structure of beta-ketoacyl synthase is similar to that of the  thiolase family ([pfam:PF00108]) and also chalcone synthase. The active site of beta-ketoacyl synthase is located between the N and C
